page.title: 10PAST BALLINDALLOCH SCHOOLS
page.content: Since the very first school in the area was built in the 17th century in what is now the churchyard ("a black bigging"of mud and turf divots)there have been many changes and additions. In 1818 the Heritors of the Parish of Inveravon decided to erect another building to accommodate both the school and school-master's dwelling on the hillside above the church.Many people at the time protested at the site chosen as they said it was "being built on a bog".Later there was built another school,which had, to begin with, only one large room.About 1911 two other rooms were added.At this school pupils were taught up to Secondary level and had about 90 pupils.Since then it has had several extensions to bring it up to modern standards as the present Primary school.
